newsitem.title: UK: NWE naphtha gains $2 on short supplies.
newsitem.headline: NWE naphtha gains $2 on short supplies.

text.p: NWE naphtha firmed on Friday due to tight supply and steady demand, dealers said.
Maintenance at Algeria's Skikda refinery, imminent shutdowns in northern European plants and heavy August purchases by Petrobras have all helped keep the market tight.
Refinery run cuts in the north and the Med could also support high N+A demand for reforming.
September swaps gained $2.00 a tonne to $196.00 and paper was bid/ask at $2.00-2.50 premium. The Sept/Oct backwardation was bid at +$4.00.
